channel.title: Mobile Movie Minute
channel.itunes:author: Robert Gold
channel.description:
We see a lot of movies. I mean a lot! And we have things to say about the good, bad and useless of those movies. Join us as we review the movies right after we've seen them - from the front seats of our hot rod MINI, on the streets of Toronto, Canada. BTW - we usually don't agree!
Call us anytime: 206-338-7200 robertintoronto@gmail.com
NEW NEW - Special Archives - all the reviews all the time: http://archives.mobilemovie.ca
channel.itunes:subtitle: Fun in-car movie reviews
channel.itunes:summary: Opinionated and irreverent movie reviews, recorded right after we've seen the movies.
channel.itunes:keywords: movie, movies, reviews, actors, actresses, hollywood, oscars, films, film, entertainment, videos, dvd

item.title: Fast Five - or The Last Hurrah?
item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:
Mobile Move Minute 175 goes completely off the rails (see the movie and you'll know what we mean) as we race to the finish with Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Dwayne Johnson and hottie Jordana Brewster.  Can you believe this thing has turned into a chick flick?  The action is all guy town, but the women love that Vin.  What am I missing here? Except for old ladies, this movie fits the bill, with 5 full-on bags of Oh-Vinnie popcorn (even from Cindy) for this non-stop-makes-no-sense action flick.  See it, and rent the first, Fast and Furios.  Bye, y'all.  Eh?

The Mobile Movie Minute Archives are freakin' unbelievable.  archives.mobilemovie.ca

MMM now featured on ReviewsInHD.com

item.title: Source Code - or Sci Fi With A Chick Flick Ending. What?
item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:
Mobile Movie Minute 174 cracks the code as Jake Gyllenhall is ultimately seduced by hottie Michelle Monaghan and stays back in time.  Or not.  What?  You'll get it by the second time jump, but you won't get the sappy chick flick ending. Vera Farmiga is featureless but effective, and Jake is somewhat convincing.  3.4 bags of blow-the-train-up-again-and-again popcorn for this it-couldn't-happen-here-could-it flick.

item.title: The Lincoln Lawyer - or Studebaker, Anyone?
item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:
Mobile Movie Minute 173 cruises the streets in a Lincoln as the best business is always conducted from the back seat of a large car.  True or what?  Remember drive-in theatres?  Wouldn't a Lincoln have been perfect?  Yep - but not so much this overly predictable piece of Grisham-like telling of Michael Connelly's  bestseller. 

Read the book or see the movie.  Don't do both.  Btw, if you don't read the book, you should know that the mom was attacked by someone in the film.  Guess who?  The answer is in the book - not the movie.  Good cast, Matthew McConaughey is fun but Marisa Tomei looks old and Ryan Phillippe is not believable.  William H. Macy (what's the H. stand for anyway?) is terrific.  2.75 bags of where's-Perry-Mason-when-we-need-him popcorn.

The Mobile Movie Minute Archives are freakin' unbelievable.  archives.mobilemovie.ca

MMM now featured on ReviewsInHD.com

item.title: Battle: LA - or WTF?
item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:
Mobile Movie Minute 172 finds Staff Sergeant Aaron Eckhart seemingly winning the war in LA all by himself. Well, almost.  He has a band of marine roustabouts that need him to survive, but that's it.  And guts.  He has a lot of guts.  He's likely the bravest marine ever to grace the silver screen.  John Wayne?  We don't think so.  2.8 bags of very-heavy-alien-metal for this wait for the video game flick.  I shouldn't be so harsh - we do get a good glimpse of yucky alien innards. And MIchelle Rodriguez.  Who else?

item.title: Unknown - Or If Only It Had Stayed That Way!
item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:
Mobile Movie Minute 171 finds Liam Neeson lost on the streets of Berlin.  Well, his memory is lost, sort of, but not his driving skills.  That guy is a badass Bullitt.  If you don't get the reference, rent Bullitt with Steve McQueen.  Best car chase scene ever.  Bar none.  In fact, here it is: http://bit.ly/h4awBA .  LIam, on the other hand, and his band of cronies, are Mission Impossible gone bad.  But you won't find that out until well into the movie, and long after you question his driving abilities.  2.8 bags of who-am-I-really popcorn for this wannabe action flick that fails on many levels.

item.title: Barney's Version - or Finally, A Serious Movie
item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:
Mobile Movie Minute 169 looks deep into the soul of a tortured man.  Why look so deep and why is he tortured?  I dunno, and you can't ask Mordecai Richler - but he is tormented - and it's highly entertaining. And the movie even features Dustin Hoffman in (finally) a believable role. This is one good flick, so I don't expect it to appeal to many of our regular listeners.  No really, the worse the movie, the higher our downloads.  Go figure. 4.2 bags of  they-almost-bought-all the-Golden-Globes-but-The-Social-Network-beat-them-to-it popcorn.  See this film.

item.title: True Grit - or Give The Kid The Oscar!
item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:
Mobile Movie Minute 168 does a redo of John Wayne's classic True Grit.  Wayne won an Oscar for his performance, but that is not happening here.  Matt Damon is a joke and Jeff Bridges is so irritating I had to cover my ears whenever he opened his mouth.  Hailee Steinfeld on the other hand is a joy to watch.  3.8 bags of remixed popcorn for this redo of a good ole cowboy yarn.  No indians though, just cowboys.  And no saloon, either.

Special thanks to our Group Of Six Review Crew.

item.title: The King's Speech - or Who Knew?
item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:
Mobile Movie Minute 167 takes a jaunt down memory lane to 70 years ago when radio was everywhere and the King had to be Kingly.  Tough if you're George The Sixth and have a speech impediment.  In rushes Geoffrey Rush to save the day for King Colin Firth.  Terrific acting and a good story to-boot! Unusual these days, imho.  4.0 bags of are-you-talkin'-to-me popcorn for this footnote to history.

item.title: Tron Legacy - or The Dude Returns In 3D!
item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:
Mobile Movie Minute 166 strikes out on xmas eve for our annual movie spectacular.  Tron Legacy is our goodwill tiding for this year, and it's a tired bit of rehashed tedium, with lots of IMAX 3D goodness.  Jeff Bridges jumped the shark a long time ago, so he's a write off from the beginning.  See it if you're a cultist, otherwise, buy the Daft Punk soundtrack.  3.1 bags of bigger-is-much-better popcorn for this wait-for-The-Blackhole-is-next in a series of Disney does rehashes.

item.title: The Fighter - or Beat Me Up, Micky!
item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:
Mobile Movie Minute 165 hangs out with boxing brothers Marky Mark Wahlberg and sometimes Batman Christian Bale.  Terrific film that somewhat explores crack addiction in American, and the underside of pro boxing, as dictated by a dysfuntional family intent on living off the efforts of the baby bother of seven wacko sisters, an older brother and of course, the control-freak mother.  What a family.  4.6 bags of turnbuckle popcorn for this amazing effort.  Oscars all around!

item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:
Mobile Movie Minute 164 takes a trip down memory lane with a bunch of CIA geezers, itching to get back in the saddle.  And they do, blowing everything up while they're at it.  Should be good fun, but it's really a who cares flick.  One thing for sure, it's not Die Hard. Good thing it was sourced from a graphic novel, or it would be complete crap.  3.1 bags of what's-next-for-Bruce popcorn for this comic book shoot 'em up.

item.title: Black Swan - or It Knocked Rick's Socks Off!
item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:
Mobile Movie Minute 163 goes to the ballet, sort of.  We follow the fragile White Swan of Swan Lake fame, as she transmorphs into the nefarious Black Swan.  Then she dies.  Oh, did I just give something away?  Not likely, as who doesn't know the story of Swan Lake?  And if you don't, it's told to you early in the flick by the ballet director, and then everything comes into focus.  Sure.  At least Natalie Portman knows how to act - she honed her craft in Star Wars, afterall. 4.0 bags of this-is-not-Psycho popcorn for this supposed thriller.

item.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1 - or Thankfully It's Almost Over!
item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:
Mobile Movie Minute 162 follows Harry, Ron and Hermione in search of the Big V's Horcruxes.  But they're no speed demons at it, that's for sure.  Lots of time hanging around a tent and turning the penultimate Harry Potter flick into a gabfest.  Yep.  More talk than magic.  Another shark jumper?  Could be - good thing it'll all be over this summer.  3.1 bags of take-me-to-Howgwarts-instead popcorn for this gee-Hermione's-getting-hot flick.

item.title: Unstoppable - or Serious Sake-Induced Review
item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:
Mobile Movie Minute 161 is just short of Unstoppable, but we try our best to put ourselves out of our misery with a good dose of sake before the film (which, in this case we needed) and a couple of shots afterwards. 

We abandon the open road review routine and head inside the Iki Ghan Sushi and Sake Palace in North Toronto.  Yes, that's what it's called, really.  Right after his wildly boring role in The Taking Of Pelham 123, Denzel jumps back in the cab and proceeds to jump the shark train in this ridiculous special effects filled train bonanza.  Ho hum.  3.4 bags of we-had-to-get-drunk-to-see-this-film popcorn.  Thanks Denzel.  Maybe next time. And who's Chris Pine anyway?

item.title: The Time Traveler's Wife - or Time Travel Drivel
item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:
Mobile Movie 130 brings back early guest reviewers Rick and Carol, which is fitting, 'cause this movie also travels back in time.  But not to those glorious days of yesteryear.  No sir, it travels to sillytime.  What a load of hooey.  No time machine, no special gizmos.  It's a genetic abnormality that bounces our hero around time.  And, apparently in the book his adventures in other times are covered.  That would be good, but not here.  Nope - he just flashes in and out of other times - naked!  Ridiculous.  3 bags of we're-being-overly-generous popcorn.  Go rent Timecop with Van Damme.  Now, that's fun!

This is a war story with a sense of humour, adventure and wonder.  Can the good guys pull it off?  It's a 'must see' film, so you'll find out soon enough.  4.9 bags of more-Brad-on-the-screen-please popcorn.  You just can't get enough of that guy!

item.description:
Mobile Movie Minute 100.  Can you believe it?  Almost two years in the making and flick number 100 was worth the wait.  Listen to the show to see if you're a winner of the great We Made It To 100 Contest.  If you ever contacted us, you just might be. 

Mickey's back, man is he back.  I wonder where he'll go from here, 'cause this flick is tough, dirty, gritty, bloody, enthralling and takes us behind scenes we'd never otherwise see.  4.4 bags of it's-fake-isn't-it popcorn.  A real winner.

item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:

item.title: Hellboy ll: The Golden Army - or Freaks And Creatures Everywhere!
item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:
Mobile  Movie Minute 82 goes all summer blockbuster with Hellboy and his little band of merry freaks.  You gotta love 'em all, but not so much Manny (the boss).  Terrific effects from the brains behind Pan's and you've got a ride that never stops.  Don't know about the Golden Army, however.  They sleep through most of the movie.  4 bags of golden army butter popcorn for this summer fiesta of mirth and merriment.

item.description:
Mobile Movie Minute 81 takes us back to the Toronto Film Society Film Noir series.  Claudette Colbert as a maybe-crazy bride-to-be and Ida Lupino as the first feminist, imho.  Rent the first, if you can.  Pass on the second!

item.title: The Dark Knight - or 5 Mobile Critics Can't Be Wrong
item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:
Mobile Movie Minute 80 takes to the streets at night and follows the Batman as he tries in vain to evade the Joker's misdeeds.  Crazy, believable, violent, action, you name it and we give Heath and Christian 5 bags of DC's best popcorn.  See this movie, and then see it again.  Oh, Batman is boring compared to the Joker.  Too bad this one's gone.  Jack, ready for a reprise?

The Mobile Movie Minute Archives rock!

item.title: City Streets/Garment Jungle - Film Noir #1
item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:
Mobile Movie Minute 79.  Special Event baby - double header Film Noir Nights all summer long!  First night features Gary Cooper in the 1931 flick 'City Streets'.  Beer, racketeering and a fresh-faced hero from the inside.  Second film stars Lee J. Cobb in the 1957 pro-union film 'The Garment Jungle'.   Well done, organizers - 4 bags of gritty popcorn for this series.

item.title: Wanted - or Preferably More Dead Than Alive
item.itunes:author: Robert Gold
item.description:
Mobile Movie Minute 78 is as crazy a movie as you'll ever see.  Driving Miss Daisy man is back, along with a band of el-creepos to take out whomsoever the knitting machine says.  What?  Yeah, I know, makes no sense, but it's fun, action-packed, and full of effects you haven't seen before.  3.8 bags of what?-I'm-a-superhero?-popcorn.  Another summer must-see flick.

The Mobile Movie Minute Archives rock!
